messages.content: What is ComfyUI-N-Suite?
ComfyUI-N-Suite is a suite of custom nodes for ComfyUI that includes Integer, string and float variable nodes, GPT nodes and video nodes.
What are the supported operating systems for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

ComfyUI-N-Nodes have been primarily tested on Windows in the default environment provided by ComfyUI and in the environment created by the notebook for paperspace specifically with the cyberes/gradient-base-py3.10:latest docker image. Any other environment has not been tested.
How can I load a video file and extract frames from it using ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

You can use the LoadVideoAdvanced node in ComfyUI-N-Nodes to load a video file and extract frames from it. The node allows you to set various parameters such as framerate, resizing options, frame limit, batch size, starting frame, and autoplay.
What is the purpose of the SaveVideo node in ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

The SaveVideo node in ComfyUI-N-Nodes takes extracted frames and metadata as input and can save them as a new video file and/or individual frame images. Video compression and frame PNG compression can be configured using this node.
How can I interpolate between extracted video frames to increase the frame rate using ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

You can use the FrameInterpolator node in ComfyUI-N-Nodes to interpolate between extracted video frames and increase the frame rate. The node uses the RIFE interpolation model to generate additional in-between frames at a higher frame rate.
What are the different types of variable nodes available in ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

ComfyUI-N-Nodes provides three types of variable nodes: Integer, Float, and String. These nodes are designed to bypass limitations in links and allow for more flexible connections between nodes in ComfyUI.
Which GPT models are supported by the GPTLoaderSimple and GPTSampler nodes in ComfyUI-N-Nodes?
The GPTLoaderSimple and GPTSampler nodes in ComfyUI-N-Nodes support four different models: GGUF models supported by llama.cpp, Llava, Moondream, and Joytag.
What is the purpose of creating a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

The purpose of creating a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes is to help improve the software by providing a clear and concise description of the bug, along with steps to reproduce the behavior, expected behavior, and any additional context.
What information should be included in the 'To Reproduce' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

The 'To Reproduce' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes should include a step-by-step process to reproduce the behavior, such as going to a specific location, clicking on a certain element, scrolling down to a specific point, and seeing the error.
What is the purpose of the 'Expected behavior' section in a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

The purpose of the 'Expected behavior' section in a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes is to provide a clear and concise description of what the user expected to happen, as opposed to what actually occurred due to the bug.
Is including a full log in a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes mandatory?

Yes, including a full log in a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes is mandatory. The full log should contain all the text in the console from the time ComfyUI was started until the time of the reported bug. Bug reports without this log will be closed.
What should be included in the 'Screenshots' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?
The 'Screenshots' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes should include any relevant screenshots that help explain the problem, if applicable.
What information should be provided in the 'Desktop' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?
The 'Desktop' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes should include information about the user's operating system, browser, and version, such as 'OS: iOS, Browser: Chrome, Version: 22'.
What should be included in the 'Additional context' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes?
The 'Additional context' section of a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Nodes should include any other relevant information or context about the problem that may help in understanding and resolving the issue.
What is the purpose of the feature request template in ComfyUI-N-Nodes?

The feature request template in ComfyUI-N-Nodes is used to suggest an idea for the project by providing a clear and concise description of the problem, the desired solution, alternative solutions considered, and any additional context or screenshots.
What should be included in the description of the problem in the feature request template?
The description of the problem in the feature request template should be clear and concise, explaining what the issue is, such as frustrations or challenges faced by users.
What should be described in the 'Describe the solution you'd like' section of the feature request template?

In the 'Describe the solution you'd like' section of the feature request template, you should provide a clear and concise description of what you want to happen or how you envision the problem being solved.
What is the purpose of the 'Describe alternatives you've considered' section in the feature request template?

The purpose of the 'Describe alternatives you've considered' section in the feature request template is to provide a clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features that have been considered before making the feature request.
What can be added in the 'Additional context' section of the feature request template?
In the 'Additional context' section of the feature request template, you can add any other relevant information, context, or screenshots that help explain or support the feature request.
What labels should be assigned to the feature request in ComfyUI-N-Nodes?
The feature request in ComfyUI-N-Nodes should be assigned the 'enhancement' label.
Can assignees be added to the feature request in ComfyUI-N-Nodes?
Yes, assignees can be added to the feature request in ComfyUI-N-Nodes, but it is not mandatory as the template shows an empty field for assignees.
